oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Experiential Learnings Inclimate Change Mitigation and Adaptation Through Organic and Sustainable Farming in the Philippines
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Villegas, Pablito
Catedral, Isagani
Custodio, Henry
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
Biodiversity and ecosystem services
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper presents the best practices done by the Sustainable Agriculture and Organic Farmersâ€™ Cooperative to address climate change impacts in agriculture. The issues include food security and access to safe, affordable and health promoting foods; water sufficiency and resilience to drought; environmental and ecological stability of an agro-ecosystem; human health and healthy lifestyle; and climate impacts on agricultural productivity.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Villegas, Pablito; Catedral, Isagani and Custodio, Henry (0201) Experiential Learnings Inclimate Change Mitigation and Adaptation Through Organic and Sustainable Farming in the Philippines. Paper at: IFOAM Organic World Congress 2014, Istanbul, Turkey, 13-15 October 2014. [Completed]
